Facility Description 



The Linde facility at La Porte, Texas is a hydrogen production plant. The facility takes gaseous hydrogen from the Linde Gulf Coast pipeline, which we then purify and liquefy. The final cryogenic liquid hydrogen product is stored in an insulated storage tank and is shipped by truck throughout the US. 



Regulated Substances 



This facility uses, manufactures, or stores a chemical listed in part 68 of Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations, beyond a threshold quantity, as established by the EPA; 

Liquid and gaseous Hydrogen - Manufactured on-site and shipped to customer by truck.



Accidental Release Prevention Policy

 

Linde is dedicated to being the best performing industrial gas company in all aspects of our business, including safety, health, and environmental affairs. Our safety, health, and environmental policy calls for a commitment to protecting the health and safety of our employees, contractors, customers, and communities where we operate. This policy is the basis for engineering and construction programs that produce equipment and process systems that minimize the possibility of accidental chemical releases and operational safety programs that ensure safe operation of our facilities. Linde is committed to the continuous improvement of these programs. 



Linde is an active member of the American Chemistry Council (ACC) and endorses ACC's program of Responsible Care; Employee Health and Safety Code of Management Practices.



Prevention Program

 

In accordance with OSHA's Process Safety Management standard and EPA's Risk Management Program rule, the La Porte, TX Hydrogen Production facility has a comprehensive accident prevention program in place. This program is built around process safety concepts such as:



-    Technical documentation of Process Safety Information, describing the physical properties of the hazardous substances, the safety systems in place to control these substances, and the critical operating parame

ters of the associated equipment and systems.



-    Procedures and programs to develop, maintain, and control key program elements such as process operations, equipment mechanical integrity, employee training, management of change, hot work permits, incident investigation, and contractor activity.



-    Initial and periodic review of new or modified processes through application of comprehensive design safety and management of change programs that include Process Hazard Analysis study and pre-startup review.



Linde has an employee participation program that promotes involvement in the process safety program and helps ensure understanding of facility-specific elements of the safety program. 



The prevention program is audited in accordance with RMP regulations to ensure that the process safety concepts and practices are in place and working effectively. 



Chemical-specific Prevention Steps

 

In addition to the required prevention program elements, we have implemented safety features specific to the covered process at our facility. Following is a description of some of these safety features. 



Hydrogen liquid storage and Hydrogen gaseous operations

 

Storage area is monitored by plant personnel; Operators monitor storage area via remote video monitoring equipment. System has automatic shutdown of fill valves. We also have lower explosive limit atmospheric monitoring and deluge systems.



Five Year Accident History



The Linde La Porte, TX hydrogen production process is a new process.  The La Porte facility currently has three on-site Bulk Air Gases Production facilities and the accident history indicates continuous safe operation of these non-covered chemical processes over the last five years. There have been no non-covered process releases that resulted in a recordable accident. 



Emergency Response Programs

 

Linde has an emergency response program in place to minimize the effects of accidental release of regulated substances on employees, the publi

c, and the environment. The La Porte, TX Hydrogen Production location will be a "non-responding facility" as defined in section 8.1 of the CEPPO General Guidance for Risk Management Programs (July 1998), i.e. Linde employees will respond to minor incidents. 



For other than minor incidents Linde has in place an emergency response plan in coordination with the Office of Emergency Management for La Porte, Texas. 



All facility employees are trained in their role in the emergency plan and emergency drills are conducted at least annually.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety

 

Linde has a commitment to safety that is expressed in a company-wide goal of "Zero/Zero", which means zero accidents and zero injuries or illnesses at each and every location. We look to constantly improve the safety of our processes using recommendations developed through the prevention program and a program soliciting safe suggestions from our employees.
